nodes.id: How might we leverage AI to enhance personalized learning experiences?
How might we use AI to improve healthcare diagnostics and treatment planning?
How might we employ AI to optimize resource allocation and reduce waste in various industries?
How might we harness AI to enhance public safety and security?
How might we utilize AI to foster creativity and innovation in various fields?
How might we apply AI to promote environmental sustainability and combat climate change?
How might we leverage AI to improve mental health support and treatment?
How might we use AI to enhance accessibility and inclusivity for people with disabilities?
How might we employ AI to improve disaster response and humanitarian aid efforts?
How might we use AI to foster global collaboration and knowledge sharing?
How are prisons and their population susceptible to climate change conditions and if so what are the implications wrt moving them, saving them, etc?
In some places/cases Prison Population augment workforce (with their own unique caveats); How would a reduction on said work force impact X?

Will these populations be able to adapt in time either by adapting to limited clean water conditions or reversing same conditions?  Or will they then be confronted with a migration or die scenario?  And what impact will an adapting to less clean water available conditions have on the population?
How will urbanization in Africa look different than urbanization on other continents, and what will be the economic and political impact?
How might the rise of trash villages improve economics for "slum residents" via innovation in recycling and entreprenuership?
Could (and how) the evolving Africa needs be used as both an incubator and lab for newer, cleaner technologies and methods such that all benefit?

Clean Slate US Cities: Can rural areas that currently produce vast amounts of energy become population centers/magenets that utilize locally sourced energy and incentivize net zero CO2 emissions (and air pollutants) and provide products and services for people who move to energy rich regions
How might the urban/rural divide post climate-driven migration impact socio-economic and cultural divides in terms of access to cultural and educational centers?
Is it about improving our cities (infrastructure etc.) or evolving our models for organizing humans and their enterprise?
How might governmental coordination improve environmental outcomes for impacted communities via utilizing incentives and ongoing social comms?
How might the engagement of underserved communities impact the sustainability of coastal and urban communities?
Federal and state governments need to subsidize cover cropping as a climate change mitigation tactic everwhere in the world.
How does climate change and geoengineering impact the priorities of where we have invested in security and where there are gaps that could become higher risk due to these changes?
If global coordination of GeoEngineering actions is achieved; What other cooperation opportunities arise creating new alliance blocks?

How might new data technologies enable more democratic participation? Likewise, how might they negatively impact (e.g. AI making it easier to create and disseminate disinformation that destabilizes governance and societies)

Could we in effect develop an economic model in which we pay people to go somewhere and perform some restorative interaction as part of their "travel"?  At scale? Shifting population around where needed?
How might advances in semiconductor technology improve economics via high security quantum computing?

If everybody is a sensor platform (via wearables) and the data is seen as valuable; will the sensor platforms be exploited as "things" or will new economic mode arise allowing a sensor platform to negotiate on a similar/equal footing to the data consumers?
How might insurance companies invest in geoengineering to mitigate their risks?
How might constant health monitoring change behaviors and introduce either risks or benefits to security and civil liberties in ways that impact far beyond the health industry?
How might technologies be governed (a la blockchain) to overcome issues of costs/benefits in climate change?

Any transition between current state and a future more sustainable technological base will be traumatic to the system.  How can the system shocks be mitigated so as to speed and not stop said transition? (NOTE: the original was in the context of energy economy transition from current to more sustainable)
How might monitoring improve quality of life factors (like air) to impacted communities under stress?

Will a focus on new environments exploration (before not possible) lead to a micro focus on said environments (further specialization on details of same) or a a more broader technical perspective and discovery phase? (NOTE: original scope was advanced tek allowing for exploration of remote, hostile previously unexplored envs)
How might medical care be facilitated by wearables in a future with a scarce healthcare workforce, or people can't physically get to healthcare facilities?
How might longstanding, intractable collective action problems be solved by economic engineering methods enabled by crypto and other data economic techologies?

As "Fabs" become more critical will they be seen and treated like national security resources to be protected as such?  Will the need lead to a semi (or total) militarization of sorts for that industry? (NOTE: original scope expansion of native semiconductor industry)
If Fabs proliferate or return how will their negative environmental impact be deal with/ameliorated?  Will it?

How might data technologies incentivize actors across multiple sectors and levels to take on activities that lead to disaster mitigation (e.g. improve building standards, reduce fuels that could feed wildfires, build resiliency into communities and companies)?
Can NASA use novel methods to keep the innovation pipeline in industry energized even during cyclic economic times?
How does climate change and severe weather events impact the % of airspace that is navigable by aircraft?

How are increasing number of tornadoes affecting the need for aerospace vehicles that interact with storms to study them and and potentially alter them by physical disruption through new vehicle designs?
How does climate change and severe weather events impact the viability of current military installations from a geographical standpoint?
How might increased monitoring of weather and the environment improve routing models and vehicle design for safer and more reliable transportation via AI, IoT, wearables, etc.?
How might weather changes impact the viability of long-range ocean transport e.g. commercial shipping?
And by extension - How does climate change and severe weather events impact the viability of current civilian installations(needed infra such as airports) from a geographical standpoint?
How might the coordination of geoengineering efforts across universities, public and private organizations be leveraged to reduce severe weather events?
How might oceanic ecosystems be impacted by the unintended consequences of genetically engineered agriculture (for all types of organisms)?
How might oceanic ecosystems be impacted by the unintended consequences of fertilization for carbon dioxide removal?
How might oceanic ecosystems be impacted by the unintended consequences of genetically engineering humans?
How might oceanic ecosystems be impacted by the unintended consequences of genetic programming?
How do changing oceanic ecosystems impact food security and transport security?
How might weather manipulation (like cloud seeding) reduce ocean acidification and soil degradation?
Might bioweapons lead to pathogens that would catastrophically impact oceanic and marine/coastal species and environments?
How might new organisms evolve to fill niches opened because of species decline, oceanic fertilization, or other trends?
How might oceanic ecosystems be impacted by the unintended consequences of genetically engineered bioweapons and biosecurity mechanisms?

What changes to oceanic ecosystems may be sustainable and positive in terms of mitigating climate change and supporting human civilizations on the ocean or below the water, and how could these be achieved?
Are there potentially catastrophic security risks related to oceanic ecosystems that could result from bioengineering of humans or oceanic/marine/coastal species?
How can the increasing number of earth science databases enable planet-scale earth system management coordination through aviation via monitoring, sampling, and active modification?
How might increased use of wearables and decreasing digital privacy concerns improve the available data for geoengineering planners via big data processing techniques?
How might private enterprise (e.g. consumer packaged goods) drive policy change around climate and the adoption of standards for climate accounting and climate credit trading?
How might conductivity research improve access to power for public consumers via alleviating utility costs?
How will the scarcity of drinkable water become a driver for climate-related migration?
How will the impact to current power suppliers be managed (change management) so as to minimize negatives and streamline adoption to new state?
How will the scarcity of drinkable water impact the liveability of future MegaCities?
How might we use the technology standards process to establish international agreements around Climate Change?
Could this result in new architectural designs for power grids (more scalable, more resilient etc.) regardless of power source?

How could climate change be a forcing function for adopting measurement and accounting standards for climate change credits including carbon and other types of credits (e.g. credits for lithium battery recycling?)
How might carbon be captured usefully at scale (e.g. trees)?
How might new organisms be engineered to fill niches opened because of species decline, oceanic fertilization, or other trends, and provide benefits to the environment and society?
How will food security issues impact the viability of high-density population centers?
How will food security issues impact supply chain construction and resiliency?
How will food security issues shift priorities for political leaders?

How might exploring the development of vehicles with the capability to travel in air and water (and crossing back and forth a water-air interface) open new economic, social, scientific, and defense opportunities that can contribute to managing the earth system and increasing need to expand human presence in, and use of, the biosphere?
How can we develop better methods (ex. mining, construction) to ameliorate the negative effects of GeoEngineering Interventions?
How might ubiquitous energy generation reduce carbon emissions?
How might self-replicating autonomous bio-engineered flying things (of any size) be used for geoengineering?
Might bioweapons catastrophically impact food production, and if so, how to prevent or mitigate?
Given the perishability of some food items; Could this lead to a luxury item market dynamic requiring fast transportation of said "luxury goods" (ie food) to "haves" type communities?
Could there be a creation of a food driven economy/trade market? (Romans with ice in summer)
How might genetically engineering, or other, technology meant for CO2 capture disrupt other portions of the ecosystem.
COuld nanotechnologies be designed to mitigate climate change be altered to pass from the air into the blood stream of humans?
How, and who decides, does genetically engineered  technology get introduced into environment, marketplace, or commercially? How is it done now?
Will the need/desire for certain types of information cause a valuation (viewpoint) favoring some populations over others?
How might monitoring improve equity of Climate Change outcomes?
How might we improve the equity of participation of LMIC communities impacted by Climate Change?
How to avoid the Big Brother effect?  Is the provided (perceived) benefit enough to overcome said effect? (NOTE: original context was in the scope of constant monitoring and sensing)
How might AI improve the equity of welfare or economic attainment across borders and regions?
How might TinyML improve adoption of wearables by the underprivileged for early detection and warning of disasters via economies of scale?
How might AI analysis and predictions improve environmental outcomes for underprivileged communities via utilizing distributed data management?
In a world with ubiquitous sensing, how is it decided who or what does the sensing, and who makes the decision? Who receives the benefits of the data that is collected?
How will the scarcity of drinkable water become a driver for climate-related migration?
How might we minimize crash landing drones and air vehicles?
How might we harvest energy and shield against radiation with melanin?
How might we enable trust in AI/ML applications and development
How might we improve airborne communication with Vortex Beam Communication for Interference Mitigation?
How might we eliminate carbon emissions with High-temperature PEM Fuel Cell for Aviation?
How might we cool next gen aircraft?
How might we improve temperature monitoring for electrified vehicles using Optical Fiber?

How might the increase of AAM and drone players in the aviation space impact medical supply & delivery chain (more availability, more small actors, lower reporting standards, more auditing, more gaps)?
How might aviation integrate into personal, community and global lifecycles to ensure physical and mental wellness? Aviation for fractal wellness
How might the entire aviation experience be restructured to reduce its risk as a vector of pathogen transmission? (reducing unnecessary contact, etc.)

Assuming that the commercial trend towards hospital consolidation and specialization continues and patients are farther away from advanced treatments, how might aviation impact accessibility of healthcare? (See: medical staffing, changes in healthcare business models, Direct-to-consumer health apps, travel nurses, etc.)

How might personal air mobility enable democratized monitoring, treatment of medically underserved and high-risk patients? (Moving people in personal air vehicles, air ambulance, air taxis, etc. Moving person to materials, not materials to person)
Given its possible role in overall public health, what regulations/restrictions may be imposed on aviation in the future?

How might the development of vehicles with the capability to routinely travel from manufacturing facilities in low earth orbit expand the commercial sector and provide customers on Earth just in time delivery services of in-space manufactured goods?
BEAM - Wireless Beamed Energy for Advance Air Mobility
SABERS - Solid-state Architecture Batteries for Enhanced Rechargeability and Safety
SPARRCI - Sensor-based Prognostics to Avoid Runaway Reactions & Catastrophic Ignition
How might aviation support or provide regenerative tourism?
How might quality of life inprove for senior citizens by self-driving vehicles?
How might the aviation industry work with medical researchers on clinical trial representation and equity?
How might aviation mitigate growth of drug resistant bacteria due to heavy metal manufacturing and usage? (advanced manufacturing, airport safety protocols, and aircraft design)
How might the aviation industry improve the medical cold chain?
How might medical ethics (Bodily Autonomy, Beneficence, Non-Maleficence, Justice) conflict with aviation/transportation autonomy, distributed monitoring and services?
How might aviation support the medical needs for the emerging space economy (10-20 years)?
How will food security issues impact the viability of high-density population centers?
Given the perishability of some food items; Could this lead to a luxury item market dynamic requiring fast transportation of said "luxury goods" (ie food) to "haves" type communities?
AEROcAST - Advanced Exploration of Reliable Operation in Low Altitude Meteorology, Simulation, and Technology
